text: The commercial elemental powders of Cu (99.99%), Fe (99.99%) and S (99.9%) were used as starting materials.

These powders were mixed according to the compositions of CuFeS2-x (x = 0, 0.05, 0.15, 0.20, 0.25), and the mixtures were subjected to MA in a planetary ball mill (QM-2L) using a hardened stainless steel vial and ball, which was performed at 450 rpm for different times.
The weight ratio of balls to powders was kept at about 20:1, and the mill vial was filled with Ar (99.9%) atmosphere to prevent the powders from oxidation during the milling process.
The MA-derived powders were densified by SPS at different temperatures ranging from 873 to 923 K for 5 min under an axial pressure of 50 MPa.
Graphite dies were used for SPS, which was conducted in vacuum.
